Hello Karthik,

That's not necessarily simple. How do you make html into plain text? 
There is software that does that, including java libraries (see 
discussion here 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/240546/removing-html-from-a-java-string). 
One thing you could do is code a custom writer that uses one of these 
libraries. Then a question is, where does it write? It could still write 
to a warc, but if you do that you'll want to be careful that what you 
write conforms to the warc spec. If not warc, then you will have to come 
up with some other system, which may not be trivial.

It might make more sense to convert to plain text outside of heritrix, 
by running some postprocessing on the warcs, although that probably also 
will not be trivial.

Noah

On 12/07/2011 05:02 AM, karthiksmv wrote:
> I am using heritrix to crawl web pages and it stores information like response headers and html tags but I need to remove the response headers and html tags. To make it simple I just want heritrix to download the webpage as plain text.
